body_html:
Which of the two would be faster or more readable or whatsoever?

This is how it's done in python_speech_features.sigproc.framesig:
indices_steps = array_ops.transpose(array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0, num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 0), [frame_length, 1]))

But I figured out that, because expand_dims is already inserted explicitly:
indices_steps = array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0, num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 1), [1, frame_length])
body_text:
Which of the two would be faster or more readable or whatsoever?
This is how it's done in python_speech_features.sigproc.framesig:
indices_steps = array_ops.transpose(array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0, num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 0), [frame_length, 1]))
But I figured out that, because expand_dims is already inserted explicitly:
indices_steps = array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0, num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 1), [1, frame_length])
body:
Which of the two would be faster or more readable or whatsoever?

This is how it's done in `python_speech_features.sigproc.framesig`:
`indices_steps = array_ops.transpose(array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0, num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 0), [frame_length, 1]))`

But I figured out that, because `expand_dims` is already inserted explicitly:
`indices_steps = array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0, num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 1), [1, frame_length])`
